poem:
Voices in the Commons  

Words like restless birds  
flit, stain the quiet air—  
Starmer's deflection,  
a parliament's theatre.  

In the echoing chamber,  
Gray's shadow lingers,  
as Lammy charts islands  
on unfurling maps.  

Jones speaks last,  
in a world dissolving,  
smoke writes  
our collective future.  

Silence swells,  
the earth waits.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
